channel.title: New Home 317!
channel.description: I just made my first 317 :) :) :) i used sombody elses source well i dont wanna leech it so how do i change home?

item.title: New Home 317!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

You add the items you want to. Go to client.java and search for makeGlobalObject(
Now you’re going to have to find out what item you want added. For example,
makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, ID, 0, 10);
Now the XXXX, states the Xcoordinate, as for the YYYY, states the Ycoordinate.
The ID, is the object id, and the 0, is the object’s rotation. (The direction it faces.) Finally, the 10 states the specific type of object. (Don’t worry though, as you will not need to edit that part.)

Now you just have to edit the XXXX, YYYY, ID, 0, to the desired position, and object id.

Read full topic

item.title: New Home 317!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

srpwnz:

lol kk i know how to make items now can any1 help me making a new home?

First, find a suitable place for having the home. You need to decide what all is going to be included, most Delta bases have thieving, some portals, and shops at home. If you want more, you need to find a place suitable for all the stuff you want. You don’t want everything to cluttered.

Read full topic

item.title: New Home 317!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:5, topic:307980”]ex. MakeGlobalObject(9999,9999,0)

the first two are the x and y coordinates and the 0 is the height[/quote]

The proper format is: makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, ID, 10);

item.title: New Home 317!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

The makeGlobalObject method is a line of code that recognized objects inside the cache, or models folder (if custom). It spawns the objects into the game, to the desired positions.

@ChaosPkers wrote:
